title: Dr. Lewis Kuller, a Father of Preventive Cardiology, Dies at 88
description: His clinical studies focused largely on how to reduce the risk factors of cardiovascular disease. He also established a link between menopause and heart disease.
dc:creator: Richard Sandomir
media:credit: Scott Goldsmith for The New York Times
media:description: Dr. Lewis Kuller with a patient undergoing an ultrasound test in 1995. He helped develop inexpensive, noninvasive tests to predict heart disease and strokes.
